page.description: Builds and Returns an index handle for the relation_change and relation_add commands.
page.original:
&ltTBL>.RELATION_TAG() Syntax Handle as N = &ltTBL>.RELATION_TAG( Order as C, Filter as C [, Flags as C ] ) ArgumentDescription OrderA character order expression that sorts selected records. FilterA character filter expression that selects records in the table. FlagsOptional. Default = "" (Ascending, not unique). A string of character flags that can specify a descending sort order ('D'), and or include only records with unique key values ('U').
Description The &ltTBL>.RELATION_TAG() method builds an index tag in the production index file for the table, and returns a handle for the index. It is used in conjunction with the <TBL>.RELATION_ADD() and <TBL>.RELATION_CHANGE() methods. Example dim tbl as P tbl = table.open("customer") ? tbl.relation_tag("left(lastname,1) + left(firstname,1)") = 83951618.000000
See Also Table Functions and Methods, Index Functions and Methods, Writing Expressions
